sentences.english: They raise the national flag and the national hymn starts.
Please stand for the national anthem.
Soon after, she began singing the national anthem regularly for Philadelphia's professional sports teams.
sentences.chinese: 稍後，她就開始經常爲費城專業運動隊演唱國歌。

sentences.english: The military band played the national anthems of China and Spain with 21 salutes lingering in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 在雄壯的21響禮炮聲中，軍樂隊演奏中西兩國國歌。

sentences.english: The station signs on with the playing of the National Anthem.
sentences.chinese: 電臺以奏國歌開始一天的廣播。

sentences.english: At his bidding, the delegates rose and sang the national anthem.
sentences.chinese: 按照他的要求，代表們起立唱國歌。

sentences.english: Nothing wrong in throwing out someone who doesn t respect National anthem or the flag.
sentences.chinese: 把那些不尊重國歌或國旗的人扔出劇院沒有任何錯。

sentences.english: The playing of the national anthem precedes all sports events.
sentences.chinese: 先奏國歌，然後開始進行各項運動項目。

sentences.english: The concert concluded with the National Anthem.
sentences.chinese: 音樂會在國歌聲中結束。

sentences.english: We always stand when the National Anthem is played in deference to the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 奏國歌時我們總是站立着，以此表示對女王的敬意。

sentences.english: Raise the national flag. Play the national anthem. Salute!
sentences.chinese: 升國旗，奏國歌，全體行禮。

sentences.english: It is also mentioned in South Korea's national anthem.
sentences.chinese: 南韓的國歌中也提到了白頭山。

sentences.english: The student finishes singing the Rwandan national anthem, and takes in the applause.
sentences.chinese: 學生們唱畢盧旺達國歌，教室裏響起熱烈地掌聲。

sentences.english: Verse anthems alternated choral sections with accompanied solos.
sentences.chinese: 詩歌國歌合唱節交替的陪同下與獨奏。

sentences.english: All the representatives stood up to sing the national anthem.
sentences.chinese: 代表們全體起立，共唱國歌。

definition: March of the Volunteer Army (PRC National Anthem)
pinyin: Yi4 yong3 jun1 Jin4 xing2 qu3

definition: broadcast/CL:個|个[ge4]/broadcasting/to broadcast/(formal) to propagate/to publicize
(of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows
